ygData.subject: RE: jewelcraft trivial
ygData.msgSnippet: I think the point was that malachite was trivial. Therefore it should not have given him a skill raise.
ygData.messageBody:
I think the point was that malachite was trivial. Therefore it should not
have given him a skill raise.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Cent [SMTP:jcent@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, July 28, 1999 8:38 AM
> To: Dorris, Bob
> Cc: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] jewelcraft trivial
>
> From: Jason Cent <jcent@...>
>
> I have often gotten Skill raises on failures...not uncommon or
> buggy....
>
>
> Fistlebane
>
>
>
> From: "Dorris, Bob" <bob_dorris@...> on 07/28/99 06:12 AM
> PDT
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com@SMTP@Exchange
> cc:
> Subject: [eqenchanters] jewelcraft trivial
>
> From: "Dorris, Bob" <bob_dorris@...>
>
> I have started a new enchanter on the newest server. I just to
> level 10
> last night and began working on my jewelcraft skill. I put my 20
> skill
> points in and began working on malachite rings. I failed 5 times,
> no biggie
> expected something like that, but then I made one and got a trivial
> message.
> I then made a lapis necklace and got the same trivial message. I
> failed on
> a malachite and got a skill raise.
>
> Something screwy going on.
>
> I did a petition and the guide had me do a feedback as well.
> Supposedly
> there were no changes to jewelcraft. Buyer Beware ).
>
> Valore
>
>
>
